Andy Coulson 's resignation: David Cameron and a question of judgment- Telegraph Blogs Ben Brogan: Presentationally, this looks terrible. Mr David Cameron is open to the charge that his judgment was faulty when he appointed Mr Andy Coulson . His line that his adviser paid his dues by resigning once, that he should not have to resign twice for the same mistake looks foolhardy. It is also bad news for George Osborne , who liked to take the credit for talent spotting Mr Andy Coulson and securing his appointment. spark for Detroit after a slow start, winning his first game since joining the Pistons, 100-92 over the Sacramento Martin Luther King on Tuesday night. "It was a huge lift off of me," Allen Iverson said. I knew it would happen. You think every game you go out and play it's going to happen. It feels good. I wanted to get the monkey off my back. I'm just excited that I got my first win and I can now try to get a lot more. Tayshaun Prince added 26 points and 11 rebounds for the Pistons, who had lost their first two games since acquiring Allen Iverson from Denver last week for All-Star point guard Chauncey Billups , key reserve Antonio McDyess and Cheikh Samb .
